content.question: ©Werner Forman Archive/Bridgeman Images The work shown can be attributed to the Sande Society’s Bundu mask tradition because of the

choices.label: complex hairstyle meant to exemplify male strength
glossy black surface representing a woman’s inner beauty
small mouth symbolizing the modesty of old age
hollow cavity that was carved to hold medicinal materials

content.answer: glossy black surface representing a woman’s inner beauty

topic.text: 6.2: Purpose and Audience in African Art

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art historical style, or object type from the image set.
